node.statement: Global assembly via sequential patching: The local smoothings are assembled into a global smooth Lagrangian K_t by a two-phase procedure. Phase A: smooth all vertices simultaneously using disjoint balls B_delta(v) (supports are disjoint so no interference; the composition of compactly supported Hamiltonians with disjoint support is well-defined). Phase B: smooth all remaining edge singularities (after Phase A, edges meet vertex regions in smooth Lagrangian arcs; edge smoothings have disjoint supports away from vertex balls). The sequential approach avoids nonlinear patching issues inherent in partitions of unity for the Lagrangian condition.
